title: Toxoplasma gondii
summary: Toxoplasma gondii (/ˈtɒksoʊplæzmə ˈɡɒndiaɪ/) is an obligate intracellular parasitic protozoan (specifically an apicomplexan) that causes toxoplasmosis.[3] Found worldwide, T. gondii is capable of infecting virtually all warm-blooded animals,[4]: 1  but felids, such as domestic cats, are the only known definitive hosts in which the parasite may undergo sexual reproduction.[5][6]
